definition: Application Programming Interface - A set of functions and procedures that allow applications to access features or data from an operating system, application, or other service.
Board Support Package - A collection of low-level software, drivers, and configuration files that enable ModusToolbox to work with specific hardware boards and microcontrollers.
The integrated compilation and linking system in ModusToolbox that transforms source code into executable firmware for target devices.
Pre-written sample applications and projects provided by Infineon to demonstrate specific features, peripherals, or use cases for ModusToolbox development.
A configurable option that encapsulates specific functionality or behavior within a middleware library.
An integrated tool that allows developers to step through code, set breakpoints, inspect variables, and diagnose issues in their embedded applications.
A hardware board containing a microcontroller, sensors, and other components designed for prototyping and developing embedded applications with ModusToolbox.
The ModusToolbox Assistant VS Code extension that provides integrated development tools, project management, and debugging capabilities within the VS Code environment.
Low-level software that runs directly on microcontroller hardware, providing basic operational control and interfacing with hardware components.
Hardware Abstraction Layer - A software layer that provides a consistent API for accessing hardware features across different microcontroller families.
Infineon Developer Center Launcher - A service that manages software downloads, installations, and updates for ModusToolbox tools and components.
A tool within ModusToolbox that allows developers to browse, add, and manage software libraries and middleware components in their projects.
Microcontroller Unit - A compact integrated circuit designed to govern specific operations in an embedded system, containing a processor core, memory, and programmable input/output peripherals.
Software libraries that provide additional functionality beyond the basic HAL, such as communication protocols, file systems, or graphics libraries.
Infineon's comprehensive software development framework for embedded applications, providing tools, libraries, and code examples for PSoC, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and other Infineon devices.
Pre-configured project structures that provide a starting point for specific types of applications or target hardware configurations.
Programmable System-on-Chip - Infineon's family of microcontrollers that combine a CPU core with configurable analog and digital blocks.
A guided workflow within the ModusToolbox Assistant that helps new users create their first project and understand basic development steps.
A feature in the ModusToolbox Assistant that displays a list of previously accessed projects for quick navigation and project management.
A component of the ModusToolbox Assistant that manages the installation and updating of development tools, compilers, and software packages.
The specific microcontroller or system-on-chip that your embedded application is designed to run on.
A collection of software development tools including compilers, linkers, debuggers, and other utilities needed to build embedded applications.
A USB-based programming and debugging interface commonly found on Infineon development kits, providing connectivity between the host computer and target device.
Visual Studio Code - A popular, extensible source code editor that serves as the host environment for the ModusToolbox Assistant extension.
A VS Code concept that represents a collection of folders and files that make up your development environment, including project files, settings, and configurations.
